title: 377: The British colonial law that left an anti-LGBTQ legacy in Asia
description: Created by the British, 377 has had a widespread damaging effect in former colonies, say activists.

title: Why small investors are piling into share-trading apps
description: A boom in cheaper trading is tempting some inexperienced investors to take big risks, warn experts.

title: A Pride symbol vandalised in Canada's 'prettiest little town'
description: A rainbow pedestrian crossing in Paris, Ontario was vandalised, and the town rallied to fix it.

title: Inside India's deadly mucormycosis fungus epidemic
description: BBC correspondent Yogita Limaye visits a ward battling India's mucormycosis epidemic in the wake of Covid.

title: The precarious life of a Gaza fisherman
description: Fishermen in Gaza eke out a precarious living amid restrictions over where they can cast their nets.

title: Two games, 14 goals, one giant-killing: The best day in Euros history?
description: Was 'Magic Monday' the greatest day in European Championship history?

title: England v Germany at Euro 2020: 'Time for England to redefine their biggest rivalry'
description: BBC Sport looks at a Euro 2020 last-16 fixture that could lay the groundwork for what England v Germany means for a whole new generation.

title: Marr on catching Covid after being double vaccinated
description: The BBC's Andrew Marr fell ill with Covid-19, despite being vaccinated twice.

title: Cardi B reveals pregnancy at BET Awards
description: The star announced she was expecting her second child as she picked up two awards for rap anthem WAP.

title: Euro 2020: Jurgen Klinsmann says Germany would fear Jadon Sancho - if he plays for England on Tuesday
description: Former Germany boss Jurgen Klinsmann says everyone in Germany is surprised Jadon Sancho has not had more game-time for England at Euro 2020 - but they don't want to see that change on Tuesday.

title: Euro 2020: England-Germany is chance to make history, says manager Gareth Southgate
description: England manager Gareth Southgate believes Tuesday's last-16 tie with Germany represents an opportunity for his team to "make some history".

title: Outbreaks emerge across Australia in 'new phase' of pandemic
description: For the first time in a year, Australia is battling outbreaks in different parts of the country.

title: 'Black rainstorm' warning delays Hong Kong trading
description: It was the city's first 'black rainstorm' warning of 2021 with at least 70mm of rain forecast.

title: Covid-19: Defence secretary and military heads self-isolate
description: Ben Wallace and senior commanders quarantine after armed forces boss tests positive for coronavirus.

title: Covid: Sajid Javid to update MPs on lifting measures in England
description: MPs will hear the details of a data review, used to determine if an easing can happen before 19 July.

title: FCA bans world's largest crypto-currency exchange Binance
description: The financial watchdog has ruled that Binance cannot conduct any regulated activity in the UK.

title: Matt Hancock: Labour calls for investigation into private emails
description: It follows a newspaper report that Matt Hancock used his personal email account for government business.

title: Small businesses urgently call for more Covid support
description: Payments on VAT and loans kick in from next week but many companies cannot operate until 19 July.

title: Love Island: ITV2 dating show returns after 18-month break
description: After a pandemic-enforced gap, the ITV2 dating show returns on Monday with 11 new islanders.

title: Anne Robinson on Countdown and cancel culture
description: The presenter is taking over from Nick Hewer as the host of Channel 4's daytime quiz show.

title: The tech helping parents look after their babies
description: A growing number of technology firms are aiming to help reduce the anxiety of new mums and dads.

title: Pandemic work stress: How I learned to deal with it
description: The disruption caused by the pandemic has raised fears of burnout, but workers are finding solutions.
